intro: Claytonia landbeckii, commonly known as the Sierra Pointilla, is a flowering plant native to the Sierra Nevada range in California. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and typically grows in moist, rocky habitats. The plant features fleshy, succulent leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink. It blooms in late spring to early summer and is often found in open meadows and streambanks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
